message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.NE 

Reasoning: The paper discusses the use of real-time article usage data to detect and track hot topics in a specific field, specifically using the field of computational neuroscience as an example. This involves analyzing keywords and tracking changes over time. Based on this, the most likely sub-categories are information retrieval (cs.IR) and computational linguistics (cs.CL), as these fields often involve analyzing and tracking trends in language and text data. Machine learning (cs.LG) and social and information networks (cs.SI) are also possible sub-categories, as they involve analyzing and modeling complex data sets. Finally, neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) is a possible sub-category, as it is directly related to the field of computational neuroscience.
